CustomField.description: * HMO (Health Maintenance Organization): Requires members to use a network of doctors and get referrals for specialists. Generally lower costs but less flexibility. * PPO (Preferred Provider Organization): Offers more flexibility to see out-of-network providers without referrals but at a higher cost. * POS (Point of Service): Hybrid of HMO and PPO — requires referrals like an HMO but allows out-of-network care like a PPO.
CustomField.inlineHelpText: Select the type of health insurance plan associated with this record: • HMO: Network-based care with referrals • PPO: Flexible access, higher cost • POS: Hybrid model with some flexibility and referral requirements Use this field to categorize the structure of the health coverage provided.
CustomField.label: Medical Insurance Plan Type
